seo.title: Personal Belongings Shipping Germany to France | Intrelo
seo.description: Moving from Germany to France in 1–3 days. Shared border, no customs within the EU. Direct road transport, door-to-door delivery.

og.title: Moving from Germany to France — 1–3 Days Direct
og.description: Shared border. Direct delivery, no customs. Door-to-door service.

lsi_keywords: moving to france cost from germany

hero.subtitle: We were the official carrier of the Queen of Britain. The fastest European route — 1–3 days by road. Shared border, no customs within the EU. Direct delivery door to door. Bilingual DE/FR team. Strasbourg in 2 hours from the border, Paris in 6.

process.title: How your move to France works
process.subtitle: Shared border, single EU space. Direct delivery in 1–3 days. No customs, no reloadings. The simplest international route.

items.text: Consultation — photos/video via WhatsApp. Free on-site survey anywhere in Germany.
On-site packing — compact boxes for Parisian lifts. Haussmann buildings have narrow entrances.
Same-day loading in border cities. Consolidation warehouse for larger volumes.
No customs within the EU — free movement. CMR and transport documents only.
Strasbourg — 2 hrs from border. Paris — 6 hrs. Lyon — 7 hrs. Nice — 10 hrs. Direct, no stops.
No reloading — one vehicle, one driver, straight to your door in France.
Paris, Lyon, Marseille, Nice, Bordeaux, Toulouse, Strasbourg, Corsica — anywhere in France.
Paris specifics — Haussmann buildings: narrow lifts, mansard floors, 6th floor walk-ups. External hoist available.
Unpacking, placement, furniture assembly. Packaging removal included.

cards.text: Germany and France are EU founding members. Zero duties, zero declarations. Transport documents only.

cards.text: Haussmann buildings, narrow lifts, mansard floors. We know how to deliver to 6th floor with no lift.

cards.text: Saarbrücken → Strasbourg: 1.5 hours. Freiburg → Mulhouse: 1 hour. Same-day delivery possible.

packing.title: Packing for your move to France
packing.subtitle: Short direct route — standard EU packing. Special focus on compact boxes for Parisian lifts and Haussmann building constraints.

items.text: Acid-free paper for delicate items
Bubble wrap for glass and fragile items
PE foam for corners and edges
Compact boxes for Parisian lifts (max 60×40×40 cm for Haussmann buildings)
Wardrobe boxes — may need to go in pieces through narrow doors
Book boxes — small and heavy-duty for Parisian walk-ups
Dismantling oversized furniture for narrow Haussmann staircases
Blanket wrapping for sofas and wardrobes
Corner protectors for tight hallways and doorframes
Garment bags for suits and delicate items
Vacuum bags for winter items
Individual shoe packing
Anti-static film for laptops and monitors
Original boxes or custom crating
Foam inserts for secure transit
Multi-layer dish packing with dividers
Custom art crating — gallery standard
Foam inserts for figurines and décor

transport.title: Shipping methods: Germany to France
transport.subtitle: Shared border — road is the primary and fastest method. Sea for Corsica and large volumes.

items.text: Sprinter — studio flat, 1–3 days

Hamburg → Marseille/Le Havre — 20 ft
40 ft container — very large volumes
Consolidated sea — from 1 m³
Frankfurt → Paris CDG — same day
Urgent document delivery
Consolidated air — from 20 kg
Road + ferry — Marseille → Corsica
Nice → Corsica (shorter crossing)
Air — for urgent island deliveries

faq.title: FAQ: Moving from Germany to France
faq.subtitle: Everything about the fastest EU moving route

items.a: No. Both EU founding members. Free movement of goods. Only CMR transport documents.

items.q: How long does the move take?
items.a: 1–3 days by road. Strasbourg: 2 hours from border. Paris: 6 hours. Nice: 10 hours. Corsica: add 1–3 days.

items.q: Can you handle Parisian Haussmann buildings?
items.a: Yes. Compact boxes for narrow lifts, furniture dismantling for tight staircases, external hoists for upper floors. We do this regularly.
Road from ~€280/m³. One-bedroom (~10 m³) — from €2,800. The most affordable EU international move.
Yes. Road to Marseille or Nice, then ferry. Total: 3–7 days. Door delivery on the island.
Possible for border regions: Saarbrücken → Strasbourg, Freiburg → Mulhouse. Contact us for availability.
Yes. Bilingual DE/FR team. All documents in both languages.

items.q: Any taxes when moving to France?
items.a: Personal belongings within the EU — no taxes, no duties. French residency registration may be needed.

items.q: How do I track my shipment?
items.a: GPS tracking. Status updates at every stage. 24/7 WhatsApp contact.
Yes. Specialist piano moving with climate protection and vibration damping.
